title: Peruvian police officer dresses as 'Spider-Man' in drug bust
description: A police officer dressed as your friendly-neighbourhood Spider-Man has busted an alleged drug smuggling crew in Peru. #spiderman #police #crime #peru #superherocostume

title: George Ayoub safely released four days after being kidnapped outside Belfield home
description: George Ayoub, the brother of a high-profile Sydney property developer, has been safely released four days after he was kidnapped in the driveway of his Belfield home. #belfield #sydney #crime #cctv #nswpolice

title: Optus CEO grilled over triple zero delay | 7NEWS
description: Optus CEO Stephen Rue faced Senate questioning over his delayed response to informing government officials about deaths during the September 18 triple zero outage. Rue waited six hours after learning of fatalities before contacting the communications regulator and eight hours before informing Minister Anika Wells, while 600 calls were ultimately affected and three people died. The CEO apologised but refused to resign, stating another leadership change would not benefit Optus or its customers. title: Train stabbing attack leaves eleven injured | 7NEWS
description: A violent stabbing attack on a packed train at Huntingdon Station injured 11 people, with one railway staff member remaining in critical condition after attempting to stop the attacker. Police have arrested a 32-year-old British-born man as the prime suspect and ruled out terrorism as a motive. Officers have been deployed across the UK's rail network to reassure commuters following the incident. title: Wild weather continues across Queensland | 7NEWS
description: South-East Queensland faces a third consecutive day of severe weather conditions with cooler temperatures and rain forecast. Hailstones the size of tennis balls and wind gusts exceeding 100 kilometres per hour battered large areas over the weekend. Severe thunderstorms may continue along the east coast from Brisbane to Central Queensland, while varied weather conditions are expected across other Australian capital cities. title: Coalition splits deepen over net zero policy | 7NEWS
description: The Coalition faces escalating internal divisions after the Nationals abandoned their net zero by 2050 policy, leaving the Liberal Party until January to decide their own position. Opposition Leader Sussan Ley is under mounting pressure as Liberal MPs remain split on whether to maintain or abandon the climate target. The policy dispute contributed to Barnaby Joyce's decision to leave the Nationals and not recontest his New England seat, with some Liberal senators now questioning the Coalition partnership. title: Andrew stripped of final military rank | 7NEWS
description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor is being stripped of his last military rank as honorary vice-admiral in the Royal Navy by the British government on the wishes of King Charles. It remains unclear whether he will also lose his military medals for his naval service, while US President Donald Trump has expressed sympathy for the royal family over the situation. title: Brisbane homes earn more than their owners | 7NEWS
description: Brisbane homes have increased in value more than the average wage over the past year, according to a PropTrack report. National house prices rose by 6% over the past 12 months, marking the sharpest recorded growth in more than two years, driven by the first home buyer scheme. Perth properties recorded the highest price increases among capital cities, followed by Brisbane. title: Wet weather sets stage for historic Melbourne Cup | 7NEWS
description: The 165th Melbourne Cup takes place tomorrow at Flemington amid wet weather conditions that may impact the $10 million race. Jockey Robbie Dolan returns to defend his title while Jamie and Ben Mellon make history as the first married couple to race against each other in the Melbourne Cup. The wet track conditions are expected to favour certain horses, with trainers confident that Flemington's excellent drainage will ensure quality racing. title: Bali murder trial witness testimony begins | 7NEWS
description: Witness testimony begins in a Balinese court for the trial of three men accused of executing Australian father Zivan Radmonovich in a brutal villa shooting. Melbourne woman Jasmine Gordius, who witnessed her husband's murder by masked gunmen, was scheduled to testify but requested an adjournment due to the emotional difficulty. The trial is expected to hear from 40 witnesses as the three Australian defendants face potential death penalty charges for premeditated murder. title: New concussion guidelines released for Australia and New Zealand | 7NEWS
description: World-leading national guidelines for concussion treatment have been officially released for Australia and New Zealand, covering all causes of concussion across the entire lifespan for both adults and children. The guidelines combat myths about prolonged rest, instead recommending 24-48 hours of rest followed by gradual return to light exercise, work and school activities. Professor Karen Barlow from the University of Queensland's Child Health Research Centre led the team developing these comprehensive guidelines to help healthcare professionals better manage the 30% of patients who experience persistent symptoms lasting over a month. title: Property developer's brother kidnapped for four days | 7NEWS
description: George Ayoub was kidnapped by three men from his Belfield home driveway at 6am last Thursday and held captive for four days before being safely released. The victim is the brother of property developer Charlie Ayoub and has no criminal record, with security cameras capturing the abduction which was posted on social media. Reformed gangster Peter Vaiusu offered ransom money via TikTok on behalf of the family, with a $1 million ransom reportedly discussed, though it's unclear if money was exchanged. title: ATO rushing to close tax loophole for renters
description: The ATO is rushing to overturn a tax loophole after a court ruling allowing renters to pocket thousands of dollars in deductions. #tax #rent #money #finance #business

title: Reserve Bank decides on interest rates | 7NEWS
description: The Reserve Bank is meeting to determine its next decision on interest rates, with 86% of economists surveyed by Finder predicting rates will remain on hold at 3.6%. The decision comes following higher than expected inflation data and will directly impact borrowers' loan repayments.
